results.title: My ambitions
results.creator_credit: David Clune, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Since David Clune first travelled to Japan at 16, he developed a thirst for travel that has never been quenched. In all his travels, he has witnessed suffering amongst the beauty and it has encouraged in him a desire to make a difference, even though he is content in Australia…for now.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Clune, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: For all practical purposes. Computer science. 4
results.creator_credit: Lance Wisniewski, Chedd-Angier Productions and COMAP
results.brief_description: Creating codes Developing the concept of binary codes, introduced in the previous episode, this program looks at some of the different codes which can be devised, including ASCII which is a 7 bit code, the Laplacian pyramid which is used for encoding pictorial images and the Hamming code, which enables computers to overcome random errors.

results.title: Italian settlement in the Yarra Valley
results.creator_credit: Maria McCarthy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Maria McCarthy recalls the stories from her youth, the ones told about her families’ voyage from Italy to Australia and settling in the Yarra Valley. She tells of her parents’ adoption of a new culture and way of life and the legacy of those decisions on the present.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maria McCarthy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Footy chicks
results.creator_credit: Rebecca Barry, Michaela Perske, SBS Independent, Red Ithaka Productions and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Many Australians love their football; many Australian women also desire the men who play it. Michaela Perske and Rebecca Barry have made a hard-hitting documentary that uses a combination of interviews, observational filming and stylised re-enactments to examine some of the interactions between football players and “Footy Chicks”. In the early 21st century, Australia saw a number of allegations of sexual assaults on women made against football players and clubs from both the Rugby League and AFL codes. Against this background, “Footy Chicks” explores the gender and sexual power relationships, and the attitudes of both players and women to the fun and the dangers involved in the sexual culture of Australian football. As well as the players and “footy chicks” who speak for themselves, interviewees include Kath Haines from Footy Fans Against Sexual Assault; Dr Clifton Evers, Lecturer in Gender Studies; Dr Catharine Lumby, Associate Professor Media Studies, and Karen Willis from the New South Wales Rape Crisis Centre.

results.title: Footloose
results.creator_credit: Herbert Ross, Craig Zadan, Lewis Rachmil and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Ren MacCormack (Kevin Bacon) moves to Bomont, a small Midwestern town with his mother (Frances Lee McCain). The town is autocratically run by the local minister, Reverend Shaw Moore (John Lithgow). A fatal car accident has caused the reverend to prohibit music, because of the corruptive influence it has over teenagers. His daughter Ariel (Lori Singer) is opposed to her father’s views and is drawn to Ren because of his life in another place where music isn’t banned, and for the possibility that he could take her away from Bomont. Ren pushes the boundaries of the Bomont community when he tries to convince the council to allow them to have a dance. Features a great soundtrack with songs from Kenny Loggins and Bonnie Tyler.

results.title: Foot in the air
results.creator_credit: Laura Brearley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In Farsi, the word for transition translates as foot in the air. With one foot in the air, Laura Brearley’s life changes dramatically. The injuries she sustained have lasted throughout her life, but they are indicative of both her vulnerability and resilience. On reflection, she realises her transition was not all bad, after all.

results.title: Digital Storytelling workshop : general public (September 2007)
results.creator_credit: Terry Melvin, Robyn Colls, Maria McCarthy, Laura Brearley, David Clune, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Life changing events, the experience of Italian immigrants, tributes to loved ones. These four digital stories, created by members of the public and facilitated by ACMI staff, are a biographical record of things closest to the hearts of the participants.

results.title: Fools rush in
results.creator_credit: Andy Tennant, Doug Draizin and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Alex Whitman is a high-flying New York yuppie sent by his company to open a nightclub in Las Vegas. It is a reluctant move for him, though once there, he meets the beautiful Mexican photographer, Isabel Fuentes. Though opposites in nearly every way, romantic sparks fly and the two have a passionate one night stand. Three months later, Isabel shows up pregnant with his child and every intention of keeping it. The two hastily marry in a Vegas chapel while an Elvis impersonator acts as the witness. A head-on collision of cultures ensues, prompting the contemplation of a break-up. A large family gathering, planned by Isabel, grows larger due to surprise family guests, thus creating a comedy of errors before the story draws to its predictable romantic close. Cast includes Matthew Perry, Salma Hayek, Jon Tenney, Carlos Gomez and Tomas Milian.

results.creator_credit: Robyn Colls, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Through Robyn’s tribute to the life and experiences of her mother, May, she gives us some insight of a spirited woman and her connection with the region in which she grew up.

results.title: Foolish wives
results.creator_credit: Erich Von Stroheim and Universal Productions
results.brief_description: Posing as a Russian count, Stroheim preys on women; regardless of social class or status. Set in Monte Carlo, the subject matter was considered “repulsive and continental.” Stroheim, bewitching in his monacle is a satanic seducer intent on possessing the wife of an American diplomat from under his nose. The wife is more than obviously attracted to the Count’s fatal charm. “Foolish wives” was an expensive production in its day, and the excellence of the sets and costumes, along with Stroheim’s masterly direction make it a cinema classic.
